entity1.name: researchers
entity1.description: A group of individuals who conduct scientific studies and investigations.
entity1.chunkid: The Effect of Music on Cognitive Development2

entity2.name: music
entity2.description: An art form and cultural activity whose medium is sound, typically combined in different ways to create melodies, harmonies, and rhythms.;;;An art form and cultural activity whose medium is sound, often organized in time and pitch.;;;An art form and cultural activity whose medium is sound, typically organized in time.;;;An art form consisting of vocal or instrumental sounds (or both) combined in such a way as to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion.;;;A form of therapy that uses music to improve physical and emotional health.;;;An art form consisting of sound and silence expressed through melody, harmony, and rhythm.;;;An art form consisting of sequences of sounds, typically organized in a way that is aesthetically pleasing or meaningful to the listener.;;;An art form and cultural activity whose medium is sound, typically organized in time and pitch.

entity3.name: cognitive development
entity3.description: Mental capabilities that allow for the processing of information, including perception, memory, language skills, and problem-solving.;;;The growth of a person's mental processes and capabilities from infancy through adulthood.;;;The process by which children acquire the ability to understand and use language effectively for communication.;;;The mental action or process of acquiring knowledge and understanding through thought, experience, and the senses.;;;The growth of mental processes that enable an individual to think, understand, and reason about the world.;;;Advantages or positive effects on mental functions such as memory, attention, and problem-solving skills.;;;The growth and change in cognitive abilities such as perception, memory, language, problem-solving, and reasoning over time.

entity7.name: memory
entity7.description: A neurological process that enables the encoding and consolidation of new information into long-term memory storage.;;;The ability to encode, store, retain, and subsequently recall information and past experiences.;;;The ability of the brain to encode, store, and retrieve information.;;;The ability to retrieve information from memory after a period of time has passed.;;;The cognitive process of accessing stored information in the brain, often involving recall or recognition.;;;The faculty by which the mind stores and remembers information.;;;The process of maintaining information over time in the human mind.

entity8.name: language skills
entity8.description: The capacity to understand and use language effectively for communication.;;;The capacity to understand and use language effectively for communication, including reading, writing, listening, and speaking.

entity9.name: problem-solving skills
entity9.description: The ability to find solutions to difficult or complex issues.;;;The ability to find solutions to difficult or complex issues through logical reasoning and creative thinking.
